simplexR 0.1.0
  • Reference

Install

# library(devtools)
# install_github("dirkdegel/simplexR")

Project page https://dirkdegel.github.io/simplexR

Simplex Algorithm

library(gMOIP)
construct_tableau <- function(A, b, c, sense){
  m <- nrow(A)
  if(sense == 1){ # max
    c <- -1 * c
  }
  t <- rbind(cbind(A, diag(m), b), c(c, rep(0, m + 1)))
  return(t)
}
optimality_check <- function(t){
  if(min(t[nrow(t), 1:ncol(t) - 1]) < 0){
    return(FALSE) # not optimal
  }
  else{
    return(TRUE) # optimal
  }
}
get_pivot_column <- function(t){
  return(which.min(t[nrow(t), 1:ncol(t) - 1]))
}
get_pivot_row <- function(t, pivot_column){
  lhs <- t[1:nrow(t) - 1, pivot_column]
  rhs <- t[1:nrow(t) - 1, ncol(t)]
  if(max(lhs) < 0){
    print("Problem is unbounded -> stop execution")
    return(-1)
  }
  else{
    theta <- rhs / lhs
    temp <- length(theta)
    for(i in 1:temp){
      if(theta[i] <= 0) # < ???
        theta[i] <- Inf
    }
    return(which.min(theta))
  }
}
pivot <- function(t, pivot_row, pivot_column){
  pivot_elemnt <- t[pivot_row, pivot_column]
  t[pivot_row, ] <- t[pivot_row, ] / pivot_elemnt
  nr <- nrow(t)
  for(r in 1:nr){
    if(r != pivot_row){
      t[r, ] <- t[r, ] - t[r, pivot_column] * t[pivot_row, ] 
    }
  }
  return(t)
}
simplex <- function(A, b, c, sense){
  tableau <- construct_tableau(A, b, c, sense)
  print("Initial Tableau (Tableau 0)")
  print(tableau)
  iter <- 1
  while(!optimality_check(tableau) & iter < 100){
    print("----------------------------------------------")
    print(paste("Iteration", iter))
    print("----------------------------------------------")
    pivot_column <- get_pivot_column(tableau)
    print(paste("Pivot column:", pivot_column))
    pivot_row <- get_pivot_row(tableau, pivot_column)
    if(pivot_row == -1){break()}
    print(paste("Pivot row:", pivot_row))
    tableau <- pivot(tableau, pivot_row, pivot_column)
    print(paste("New tableau at the end of iteration", iter))
    print(tableau)
    iter <- iter + 1 
  }
  print("----------------------------------------------")
  print("Status: ")
  print("----------------------------------------------")
}

Examples

Standard Case

\[ \begin{array}{rrcrcr} \max & 2x_1 & + & 1x_2 & \\ s.t. & 1x_1 & & & \leq & 5 \\ & 4x_1 & + & 1x_2 & \leq & 25 \\ & x_1,& & x_2 & \geq & 0 \end{array} \]

A = matrix(c(1, 0, 
             4, 1), nrow = 2, ncol = 2, byrow = TRUE)
b = c(5, 25)
c = c(2, 1)
sense = 1

simplex(A, b, c, sense)
## [1] "Initial Tableau (Tableau 0)"
##                 b
## [1,]  1  0 1 0  5
## [2,]  4  1 0 1 25
## [3,] -2 -1 0 0  0
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Iteration 1"
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Pivot column: 1"
## [1] "Pivot row: 1"
## [1] "New tableau at the end of iteration 1"
##                 b
## [1,] 1  0  1 0  5
## [2,] 0  1 -4 1  5
## [3,] 0 -1  2 0 10
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Iteration 2"
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Pivot column: 2"
## [1] "Pivot row: 2"
## [1] "New tableau at the end of iteration 2"
##                b
## [1,] 1 0  1 0  5
## [2,] 0 1 -4 1  5
## [3,] 0 0 -2 1 15
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Iteration 3"
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Pivot column: 3"
## [1] "Pivot row: 1"
## [1] "New tableau at the end of iteration 3"
##               b
## [1,] 1 0 1 0  5
## [2,] 4 1 0 1 25
## [3,] 2 0 0 1 25
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Status: "
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
cPoints <- cornerPoints(A, b)
plotPolytope(cPoints, cPoints, iso = c, crit = "max")

Standard Case 2

â€” Werners, Brigitte - Grundlagen des Operations Research (p.Â 60)

\[ \begin{array}{rrcrcr} \max & 3x_1 & + & 2x_2 & \\ s.t. & 2x_1 & + & 1x_2 & \leq & 22 \\ & 1x_1 & + & 2x_2 & \leq & 23 \\ & 4x_1 & + & 1x_2 & \leq & 40 \\ & x_1,& & x_2 & \geq & 0 \end{array} \]

A = matrix(c(2, 1, 
             1, 2,
             4, 1), nrow = 3, ncol = 2, byrow = TRUE)
b = c(22, 23, 40)
c = c(3, 2)
sense = 1

simplex(A, b, c, sense)
## [1] "Initial Tableau (Tableau 0)"
##                   b
## [1,]  2  1 1 0 0 22
## [2,]  1  2 0 1 0 23
## [3,]  4  1 0 0 1 40
## [4,] -3 -2 0 0 0  0
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Iteration 1"
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Pivot column: 1"
## [1] "Pivot row: 3"
## [1] "New tableau at the end of iteration 1"
##                         b
## [1,] 0  0.50 1 0 -0.50  2
## [2,] 0  1.75 0 1 -0.25 13
## [3,] 1  0.25 0 0  0.25 10
## [4,] 0 -1.25 0 0  0.75 30
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Iteration 2"
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Pivot column: 2"
## [1] "Pivot row: 1"
## [1] "New tableau at the end of iteration 2"
##                       b
## [1,] 0 1  2.0 0 -1.0  4
## [2,] 0 0 -3.5 1  1.5  6
## [3,] 1 0 -0.5 0  0.5  9
## [4,] 0 0  2.5 0 -0.5 35
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Iteration 3"
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Pivot column: 5"
## [1] "Pivot row: 2"
## [1] "New tableau at the end of iteration 3"
##                                   b
## [1,] 0 1 -0.3333333  0.6666667 0  8
## [2,] 0 0 -2.3333333  0.6666667 1  4
## [3,] 1 0  0.6666667 -0.3333333 0  7
## [4,] 0 0  1.3333333  0.3333333 0 37
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Status: "
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
cPoints <- cornerPoints(A, b)
plotPolytope(cPoints, cPoints, iso = c, crit = "max")

Unbounded Feasible Region, Optimal Solution

\[ \begin{array}{rrcrcr} \max &-2x_1 & + & 3x_2 & \\ s.t. &-1x_1 & + & 1x_2 & \leq & 2 \\ &-1x_1 & + & 2x_2 & \leq & 6 \\ & & & 1x_2 & \leq & 5 \\ & x_1,& & x_2 & \geq & 0 \end{array} \]

A = matrix(c(-1, 1,
             -1, 2,
              0, 1), nrow = 3, ncol = 2, byrow = TRUE)
b = c(2, 6, 5)
c = c(-2, 3)
sense = 1

simplex(A, b, c, sense)
## [1] "Initial Tableau (Tableau 0)"
##                  b
## [1,] -1  1 1 0 0 2
## [2,] -1  2 0 1 0 6
## [3,]  0  1 0 0 1 5
## [4,]  2 -3 0 0 0 0
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Iteration 1"
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Pivot column: 2"
## [1] "Pivot row: 1"
## [1] "New tableau at the end of iteration 1"
##                  b
## [1,] -1 1  1 0 0 2
## [2,]  1 0 -2 1 0 2
## [3,]  1 0 -1 0 1 3
## [4,] -1 0  3 0 0 6
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Iteration 2"
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Pivot column: 1"
## [1] "Pivot row: 2"
## [1] "New tableau at the end of iteration 2"
##                  b
## [1,] 0 1 -1  1 0 4
## [2,] 1 0 -2  1 0 2
## [3,] 0 0  1 -1 1 1
## [4,] 0 0  1  1 0 8
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Status: "
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"

Unbounded Feasible Region, no Optimal Solution

â€” Werners, Brigitte - Grundlagen des Operations Research (p.Â 60)

\[ \begin{array}{rrcrcr} \max & 2x_1 & + & 4x_2 & \\ s.t. &-2x_1 & + & 3x_2 & \leq & 12 \\ &-1x_1 & + & 3x_2 & \leq & 18 \\ & x_1,& & x_2 & \geq & 0 \end{array} \]

# unbounded feasible region, no optimal solution exists

A = matrix(c(-2, 3,
             -1, 3), nrow = 2, ncol = 2, byrow = TRUE)
b = c(12, 18)
c = c(2, 4)
sense = 1

simplex(A, b, c, sense)
## [1] "Initial Tableau (Tableau 0)"
##                 b
## [1,] -2  3 1 0 12
## [2,] -1  3 0 1 18
## [3,] -2 -4 0 0  0
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Iteration 1"
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Pivot column: 2"
## [1] "Pivot row: 1"
## [1] "New tableau at the end of iteration 1"
##                                 b
## [1,] -0.6666667 1  0.3333333 0  4
## [2,]  1.0000000 0 -1.0000000 1  6
## [3,] -4.6666667 0  1.3333333 0 16
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Iteration 2"
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Pivot column: 1"
## [1] "Pivot row: 2"
## [1] "New tableau at the end of iteration 2"
##                                b
## [1,] 0 1 -0.3333333 0.6666667  8
## [2,] 1 0 -1.0000000 1.0000000  6
## [3,] 0 0 -3.3333333 4.6666667 44
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Iteration 3"
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Pivot column: 3"
## [1] "Problem is unbounded -> stop execution"
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Status: "
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"

Dual Degeneracy

â€” Werners, Brigitte - Grundlagen des Operations Research (p.Â 62)

\[ \begin{array}{rrcrcr} \max & 3x_1 & + &1.5x_2 & \\ s.t. & 2x_1 & + & 1x_2 & \leq & 22 \\ & 1x_1 & + & 2x_2 & \leq & 23 \\ & 4x_1 & + & 1x_2 & \leq & 40 \\ & x_1,& & x_2 & \geq & 0 \end{array} \]

A = matrix(c(2, 1,
             1, 2,
             4, 1), nrow = 3, ncol = 2, byrow = TRUE)
b = c(22, 23, 40)
c = c(3, 1.5)
sense = 1

simplex(A, b, c, sense)
## [1] "Initial Tableau (Tableau 0)"
##                     b
## [1,]  2  1.0 1 0 0 22
## [2,]  1  2.0 0 1 0 23
## [3,]  4  1.0 0 0 1 40
## [4,] -3 -1.5 0 0 0  0
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Iteration 1"
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Pivot column: 1"
## [1] "Pivot row: 3"
## [1] "New tableau at the end of iteration 1"
##                         b
## [1,] 0  0.50 1 0 -0.50  2
## [2,] 0  1.75 0 1 -0.25 13
## [3,] 1  0.25 0 0  0.25 10
## [4,] 0 -0.75 0 0  0.75 30
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Iteration 2"
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Pivot column: 2"
## [1] "Pivot row: 1"
## [1] "New tableau at the end of iteration 2"
##                       b
## [1,] 0 1  2.0 0 -1.0  4
## [2,] 0 0 -3.5 1  1.5  6
## [3,] 1 0 -0.5 0  0.5  9
## [4,] 0 0  1.5 0  0.0 33
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Status: "
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
cPoints <- cornerPoints(A, b)
plotPolytope(cPoints, cPoints, iso = c, crit = "max")

Primal Degeneracy

â€” Werners, Brigitte - Grundlagen des Operations Research (p.Â 65)

\[ \begin{array}{rrcrcr} \max & 3x_1 & + & 2x_2 & \\ s.t. & 2x_1 & + & 1x_2 & \leq & 22 \\ & 1x_1 & + & 2x_2 & \leq & 23 \\ & 4x_1 & + & 1x_2 & \leq & 40 \\ & 2x_1 & + & 0.75x_2 & \leq & 21 \\ & x_1,& & x_2 & \geq & 0 \end{array} \]

A = matrix(c(2, 1,
             1, 2,
             4, 1,
             2, 3/4), nrow = 4, ncol = 2, byrow = TRUE)
b = c(22, 23, 40, 21)
c = c(3, 2)
sense = 1

simplex(A, b, c, sense)
## [1] "Initial Tableau (Tableau 0)"
##                        b
## [1,]  2  1.00 1 0 0 0 22
## [2,]  1  2.00 0 1 0 0 23
## [3,]  4  1.00 0 0 1 0 40
## [4,]  2  0.75 0 0 0 1 21
## [5,] -3 -2.00 0 0 0 0  0
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Iteration 1"
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Pivot column: 1"
## [1] "Pivot row: 3"
## [1] "New tableau at the end of iteration 1"
##                           b
## [1,] 0  0.50 1 0 -0.50 0  2
## [2,] 0  1.75 0 1 -0.25 0 13
## [3,] 1  0.25 0 0  0.25 0 10
## [4,] 0  0.25 0 0 -0.50 1  1
## [5,] 0 -1.25 0 0  0.75 0 30
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Iteration 2"
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Pivot column: 2"
## [1] "Pivot row: 1"
## [1] "New tableau at the end of iteration 2"
##                          b
## [1,] 0 1  2.0 0 -1.00 0  4
## [2,] 0 0 -3.5 1  1.50 0  6
## [3,] 1 0 -0.5 0  0.50 0  9
## [4,] 0 0 -0.5 0 -0.25 1  0
## [5,] 0 0  2.5 0 -0.50 0 35
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Iteration 3"
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Pivot column: 5"
## [1] "Pivot row: 2"
## [1] "New tableau at the end of iteration 3"
##                                     b
## [1,] 0 1 -0.3333333  0.6666667 0 0  8
## [2,] 0 0 -2.3333333  0.6666667 1 0  4
## [3,] 1 0  0.6666667 -0.3333333 0 0  7
## [4,] 0 0 -1.0833333  0.1666667 0 1  1
## [5,] 0 0  1.3333333  0.3333333 0 0 37
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
## [1] "Status: "
## [1] "----------------------------------------------"
cPoints <- cornerPoints(A, b)
plotPolytope(cPoints, cPoints, iso = c, crit = "max")
